snippet: As the United States prepares to withdraw from an unpopular war in Afghanistan, it faces challenges similar to what the country’s last occupier, the Soviet Union, had experienced.
abstract: Scholars who have studied Soviet Union's occupation in Afghanistan in 1980s say that United States, which is preparing to withdraw from its unpopular war in Afghanistan, faces challenges similar to what Soviets had experienced there; assert that continuing large-scale military assistance and maintaining long-term involvement in education and infrastructure projects will help ease Afghanistan's transition.
lead_paragraph: As the United States prepares to withdraw from an unpopular war in Afghanistan, it faces challenges similar to what the country’s last occupier, the Soviet Union, had experienced.
